intro: Coluteastrum macrostachium, commonly known as the large-stemmed cudweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Coluteastrum macrostachium is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
